name: Ultra-Blur Talc-Free Translucent Loose Setting Powder
about: What it is: A talc-free loose setting powder that is infused with hyaluronic acid for comfortable, up to 16-hour wear and ultra-blurring power...Coverage: Light.Finish: Natural and Matte.Formulation: Loose Powder.Highlighted Ingredients: - Hyaluronic Acid: Makes the powder comfortable for all skin types..- Amino Acid and Silica Powders: Create a soft-focus effect on fine lines, pores, and imperfections...Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance...What Else You Need to Know: This powder has a weightless texture, so skin looks and feels soft, smooth, and flawless. It is infused with ultra-blurring ingredients like amino acid and silica powders to blur away the look of pores, fine lines, and imperfectionsu2013with total shine absorption and zero photo flashback...Clinical Results: After 3 days of consumer testing with 71 women that used the Ultra Blur Translucent Loose Setting Powder:.- 100% agreed it sets makeup.- 99% agreed it feels comfortable.- 97% agreed it controls the look of shine on skin..This product is an Allure Best of Beauty award winner.
ingredients: -Hyaluronic Acid: Makes the powder comfortable for all skin types. .-Amino Acid and Silica Powders: Create a soft-focus effect on fine lines, pores, and imperfections...Mica, Lauroyl Lysine, Zinc Stearate, Aluminum Starch Octenylsuccinate, Silica, C13-15 Alkane, Ethylhexylglycerin, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Tocopherol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Sorbic Acid. May Contain/Peut Contenir/(+/-): Blue 1 Lake (Ci 42090), Iron Oxides (Ci 77491, Ci 77492, Ci 77499), Manganese Violet (Ci 77742), Red 7 (Ci 15850), Titanium Dioxide (Ci 77891), Ultramarines (Ci 77007), Yellow 5 Lake (Ci 19140).
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Work powder into puff by folding and rubbing the halves together. .-Tap off excess. .-Press puff onto skin using a rolling motion to set makeup. .-The finishing step to achieving Laura Mercieru2019s iconic Flawless Face: Pair with your favorite Pure Canvas Primer and Laura Mercier Foundation or Tinted Moisturizer (each sold separately) for her signature No Makeup, Makeup look.

reviews.review_title: It is a good product but maybe just not my thing
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I purchased this as something to have when I want my makeup to stay put and I want my complexion blurred out more. I have dry fair skin and this shade is really nice for me and blends in + brightens seamlessly, I find loose powders annoying and messy but no pressed powder seemed to outshine this one. For dry skin, it does not feel bad, but it does feel different since I am not use to powders on my face. When I apply it of course that 'just-moisturized' bouncy feeling goes away for me and it takes away a lot of that 'shine' that a dry skinned person might love (such as myself) but an oily skinned person probably does not. I am not one to have sensitive skin to many products and I wouldn't say I am allergic to this as I had no reaction that would be typical of allergies but my skin did have a ~weird~ feeling after immediately applying it - maybe thats normal idk lol? Ultimately I am conflicted with keeping or returning this - on one hand it does everything right that I originally wanted it to do, but I just personally don't seem to love powder on my face so it seems like a steep price to pay for something I will likely not reach for everyday and savour for nights out and events which are few and far between. I have nothing to compare this to and I don't want to be one of those reviewers that say 'don't try this' just because of my preferences, however I would say if you like powders and are looking for something to smooth out your skin and not look cakey, this is worth a try. If you're dry like me and want to try a powder, I think this is a good option for you and there is a strong chance you will love it. I can't speak for other skin types but I think its a solid product if you can get past the price.

reviews.review_title: Not a miracle, but not bad!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I received this Laura Mercier Ultra-Blur Talc-Free Translucent Loose Setting Powder in exchange for my honest review. I have large pores on my cheeks and while this is not a miracle, it does blur them a bit. I didn't have the velvet pad they recommended you use, so I poured some powder in the lid, bare minerals style, and used a brush to swirl the powder in the lid then apply to my face. I have dry skin as I live in a desert climate, so I use a moisturizing routine and prefer a Dewey look. This power takes away the look I'm going for, so I probably won't use it. If you're looking for a good setting powder that covers oil and helps balance uneven color, this would help you. My pale skin matched well with the rose tinted powder and I loved that it was lightweight and didn't feel like it clogged my pores.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brunette hair, Porcelain skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I've loved my Laura Mercier setting powder since the beginning of the youtube days so I was extremely excited to try this version as pink setting powders are truly my favorite nowadays. This powder is very light weight, so light I don't even feel it on my skin which I really love. I would say that if you are looking for extreme brightening this may not be what you're looking for, it is definitely more natural than other pink powders. The main thing I notice that I'm not really liking is that this powder has sparkle too it, not glitter but it almost has like an eye shadow sparkle to it, I'm guessing from the silica. I would definitely be aware of that before purchasing and I would highly recommend asking for a sample to try before pulling the trigger because you may not enjoy sparkle under your eyes. due to the sparkle I use this on other points of my face which is a little disappointing because I love pink powder under my eyes.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Combination skin

The large basin allows me to pick up just the right amount of powder without having powder spilling all over my counter.

I love to use it with and without a full face of make up and it sets so well and feels comfortable. Itu2019s the perfect color to brighten my eyes and I would definitely buy this product and recommend it to my friends and family.

reviews.review_text: First off, I'm 40, so a good setting powder is both essential and hard to find. It's super finely milled; so fine it feels like absolute silk - I don't even know how they do that. It does not clump up on the skin. It is the perfect peach/pink shade, so it would work for many skin tones whether warm or cool. It's humid summer and right now, all I use is this and the Laura Mercier concealer underneath. You can see from the before/after photo that it really does blur pores but doesn't make skin look too dry or baked. It's wonderful!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I received Ultra Blur Rose Translucent Loose Setting Powder from BzzAgent and Laura Mercier, to try the product and provide my honest opinion.  The product definitely smooths out my pores and gives a flawless finish initially.  I have been getting several hours of wear from the powder, but nowhere near the 16 hours promised.  My skin is fairly oily, and I think this product may be better-suited for dry or normal skin, since it is talc-free and includes hyaluronic acid for hydration.  The peachy pink tint is barely discernible, but it definitely gives fairer skin a pickup glow.  The product recommends applying with a powder puff, but no powder puff is included.  At this price point, this was surprising.  Overall, a good product with a light finish, but it does not keep oily skin shine-free for long.

reviews.review_text: I received this product for free from Laura Mercier via Bzzagent in exchange for my honest review. I've been wanting to try this setting powder for the longest time. I'll start off with the positive. It helps with shine if you have oily skin. I used this over sunscreen and helped give me a matte finish without making me look like a ghost. I even used another layer of sunscreen later in the day over this product and was not left cakey which I was worried about. The rose tint makes it blend well with my skin so I don't look pale. Overall very impressed with the formulation, specifically how it absorbs excess oil without drying me out or making me look cakey. What I don't like about it is how much it stings. This has vitamin c which I am sensitive to and I definitely had a reaction. Nothing terrible, but certainly uncomfortable. The other issue is that this product does not specify if it's  talc-free. I know it can show up as another name in ingredients so I'm worried about that. Overall, I would not recommend this to people with sensitive skin but would recommend this to people who can tolerate vitamin c and are prone to oiliness. I would also recommend that LC list talc-free on their product box if that is the case and if not consider launching a talc-free version.

It does an excellent job of both blurring and setting my makeup, but I also like to occasionally use it on its own just for its excellent oil control for my minimum makeup days as well. It blends in beautifully and it feels like nothing on my skin. A really nice feature I appreciate it has is its non photo flashback. I did some test photos and had no issues with annoying powder patches of white showing up. Iu2019ve had no issues with sensitivity or clogged pores, and I really like that it has thoughtful ingredients like hyaluronic acid and amino acids. Overall this is a fantastic translucent powder, and I highly recommend it!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this setting powder. Itu2019s not cakey and it really does make my makeup last longer. Itu2019s got a nice glow that is subtle and itu2019s well worth the price!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: The Rose Translucent Loose Setting Powder from Laura Mercier is a well-regarded product known for its ability to set makeup with a soft, flattering finish. Hereu2019s a detailed review:  Texture and Finish: The powder has an incredibly fine, silky texture that feels lightweight on the skin. It provides a soft matte finish with a hint of radiance, which is perfect for achieving a natural, flawless look.  Color and Coverage: The rose hue is designed to brighten the complexion and add a subtle, healthy glow. It works particularly well for those with fair to medium skin tones, providing a slight color correction that helps to neutralize dullness.  Application: It applies smoothly and blends easily without settling into fine lines or looking cakey. Itu2019s recommended to use a fluffy powder brush or a puff for an even application. The powder also works well for baking, especially under the eyes to set concealer and prevent creasing.  Performance: The powder effectively sets makeup, extending its wear time and reducing shine throughout the day. It controls oil without drying out the skin, making it suitable for various skin types, including combination and oily skin.  Packaging: The product comes in a classic, sturdy container with a sifter that allows for controlled dispensing. The packaging is travel-friendly and looks elegant on any vanity.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Honestly, this powder was a great addition to my makeup routine. Iu2019ve been using the regular Laura mercier translucent setting powder and Iu2019ve tried different ones from the brand but this rose one leaves my skin glowy, it doesnu2019t patch my makeup, and it honestly stays so smooth and so skin like all day. I am SO GLAD because the regular translucent powder was just not cutting it for me recently. I recommend this powder now to all my friends lol

reviews.review_text: Got this as a gift from BzzAgent in exchange for an honest review so here we go! As someone who uses almost exclusively (pink) loose powder to set my face and specifically my under eyes, I was super excited about this product drop. When opening the package I first off thought the packaging was super cute! When trying this product out I noticed even after a few days, it did not irritate my skin which is super awesome for a sensitive skin girl like me! For reference, I have a combination, leaning towards oily skin. I love the way this product was not too pink and smoothed while simultaneously brightening my under-eye. It held up fairly well throughout the day but I will say I use another pressed powder on top so be mindful of that. I did try this on a night out where people were taking flash photos and can gladly report, no flashback!!! All in all, this is a pretty good product if you are on the hunt for a new powder. I will say make sure you already have powder puffs if you do not already, I have a ton of them so it was not an issue but be mindful of this!!

reviews.review_text: Having tried various setting powders over the years, I find the Laura Mercier Ultra-Blur stands out for its talc-free formula. Compared to other high-end brands, Laura Mercier's Ultra-Blur provides a superior blend of color correction and setting properties.The peachy pink pigments subtly brighten and even out my skin tone, making it look more radiant. It offers impressive longevity, keeping my makeup in place for up to 16 hours without requiring touch-ups.As someone with combination skin, I appreciate its ability to control shine, especially in the T-zone, without making my skin feel dry. The powder is incredibly lightweight and comfortable, making it perfect for all-day wear. I believe this setting powder would be a great fit for anyone looking for a talc-free option that offers excellent performance. Whether you're new to setting powders or a seasoned user, Laura Mercier Ultra-Blur is a fantastic choice. I would highly recommend it to my friends and family, especially those with similar skin tones and concerns.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful product, but batteries not included!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was fortunate to receive Laura Mercier's Ultra-Blur Talc-Free Translucent Setting Powder courtesy of Laura Mercier and BzzAgent in exchange for my honest review.  I've been using it every day since receiving it, and I really love this product!  It locks my base in place all day and gives my skin a gorgeous, smooth looking, light, pretty glow, with just a slight shimmery pink hue.  It compliments my fair skin tone very well.  The only thing I didn't love (and actually found a bit off-putting) was the fact that the box gives very specific instructions for how  to use the velour puff to apply the powder, but then concludes by saying that the velour puff is sold separately.  It brought me back to the days of receiving the toy I'd been hoping for all season on Christmas morning as a little kid, and then being devastated to read batteries not included written on the back of the box. Fortunately, other setting powders I own come with applicators included, so I used one that looked like it might be velour, and it worked just fine - as did a setting powder brush.  I took a star off for the lack of the applicator the box instructed me to use, but otherwise I think it's great!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Dark skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have both the Translucent shade and the Deep Shade of this powder so I'll review both!  This is a great setting Talc Free setting powder for an overall luminous-but-not-sparkly finish. I included a photo comparing the Translucent shade to two other Talc Free, Silica based Translucent powders, over UD Face Tape Foundation and 3 swipes of Rare Beauty Liquid Highlighter in Flaunt.  The Laura Mercier preserves glow, but actually adds luminosity too so it is not mattifying. So it's not fair to compare it to the original which is mattifying. This provides a more 'hydrated' look! The AC one is mattifying while preserving any glow you've already applied. And the It one is even more matte and tends to diminish glow.  However none of these powders are bad, but just know what kind of finish you want and what you are buying and how you want to use it. I think the Laura Mercier is the best to set a more glowy look that you don't want to dim down.  Would definitely repurchase!   But I will say that the Deep Shade of this powder leaned a bit too orange for me. The tone of the deep shade definitely meshes in with your makeup. I will still use it but I just have to make sure I buff it out really well otherwise I can look like an oompa loompa in the daytime.  :-(

On top of it, my destination was very humid and this stuff didnt budge!  Mind you, this was a sample, but a generous size sample.  It seems to be a layering type of powder, yet did not need re-applying, the only reason I did was to test the layering properties.  This formula seems great because even this the color is translucent it is more like adaptable to many skin tones and DEFINITELY controlled my redness, which is a constant battle.  Did not dry out my skin or feel caked on.  My skin DOES get dry and flakey at times, but this did NOT make that worse.  I am definitely going to order a full size right away (tonight actually!)  I am just wondering if it comes in a pressed formula.  but sometimes that doesnt work as well. reviews.review_title: The best setting powder for combination skin!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted to use this for several months before writing a review because I often find products work well for a couple of months, then arenu2019t as effective anymore. Iu2019m glad to say I have been using this daily for seven months, and Iu2019m still happy with the results! I have combination skin that is very oily in the t-zone and can also be dry and flakey. Before finding this, I tested other brands, but never found anything better than Laura Mercier. I used Laura Mercieru2019s regular translucent powder for years, and was excited to see this new talc-free version. During the summer I donu2019t think it kept the shine on my nose at bay for quite as long as the original, but it lasts longer during the fall and winter. I still need to use an oil blotter and touch up by the afternoon; however, itu2019s the best setting powder Iu2019ve found so far. It gives my skin a smooth, natural matte finish that I really like and doesnu2019t accentuate dry spots. I donu2019t need to use much to achieve the right amount of coverage. I hope this will eventually be available in a travel size. I highly recommend trying it!
